ground_truth_bugs.description: Race condition and side effects in should_block? method
ground_truth_bugs.details: The should_block? method performs read-modify-write on match_count without atomic operations, causing race conditions under concurrent signups. Save failures are also silently ignored.

false_positives.comment: Avoid leaking user attributes in failed signup response
false_positives.reasoning: The code only returns name, username, email that the user themselves submitted. No sensitive data exposure - this is standard form repopulation behavior.

golden_false_positives.golden_comment: Regex pattern @(#{domains}) only matches domain suffixes, not full domains. evil.example.com would match whitelist entry example.com.
golden_false_positives.reasoning: This is incorrect. The regex @(example\.com) does NOT match evil.example.com because the @ must immediately precede the domain. Verified by testing: 'user@evil.example.com' =~ /@(example\.com)/i returns nil. The existing test 'should not reject partial matches' confirms the regex works correctly.
